text: joining the question!

<@U06KP87QUJW> No need to strip the inner `"`'s - please note they are regular JSON  doublequotes inside a double quoted string.
Do you know maybe someone form HS who can guide me me through this?

Bye the way - this request is for a webhook, it arrives when action is triggered on HS. In that case, what is the URL? It's `<https://api.hubapi.com>` ?

Does this string look good?
```POST<https://api.hubapi.com/[{eventId:123456,subscriptionId:1234,portalId:1234,appId:1234,occurredAt:1234,subscriptionType:deal.propertyChange,attemptNumber:0>,    objectId:1234,propertyName:dealstage,propertyValue:contractsent,changeSource:CRM_UI,sourceId:userId:64535554}]```

<@U06SDFMD947> I meant stripping the backslashes not the quotes. Sorry for the misunderstanding. If you play around with the string in this tool <https://www.devglan.com/online-tools/hmac-sha256-online> as per the screenshot do you get the correct hash?

Sorry yes, I edited it manually - so this string is well constructed before applying the hashing functions?
``` POST<https://api.hubapi.com/[{>"eventId":123456,"subscriptionId":1234,"portalId":1234,"appId":1234,"occurredAt":1234,"subscriptionType":"deal.propertyChange",       "attemptNumber":0,"objectId":1234,"propertyName":"dealstage","propertyValue":"contractsent","changeSource":"CRM_UI","sourceId":"userId:64535554"}]```

So this is a sample from one of my projects. The url is for the webhook endpoint that you need to set up. not the HubSpot one <@U06SDFMD947>

```POST<https://webhook.site/1d5744f7-bcf1-45bd-bb99-bc61a06ebc0b[{>"eventId":111111,"subscriptionId":111111,"portalId":111111,"appId":111111,"occurredAt":1701690196181,"subscriptionType":"deal.propertyChange","attemptNumber":0,"objectId":9883334098,"propertyName":"dealstage","propertyValue":"decisionmakerboughtin","changeSource":"CRM_UI","sourceId":"userId:52094771"}]1701690196833```
I see so that was my problem while I'm develing with Ngrok. Going to try that out. Thanks <@U06KP87QUJW>!
welcome <@U06SDFMD947> let me know how it goes

<@U06KP87QUJW> ~Still cannot get it working. In your example:~
```POST<https://webhook.site/1d5744f7-bcf1-45bd-bb99-bc61a06ebc0b[{>"eventId....```
Like missing `/` between `ebc0b` and  `[{"e...` ?
Because the code was:
```... 'https://' + event['requestContext']['domainName'] + '/' +  raw_payload ...```
Also `event['requestContext']['domainName']` is only a domain name like `<http://example.com|example.com>` or it has the path too like `<http://example.com/hs_callback|example.com/hs_callback>`  ?

Got it working finally. The URL has to be full URL - <protocol://domain/path/to> ! :slightly_smiling_face: and then - no slashes - just:
```method_url_body = "#{request.request_method}#{URL}#{raw_payload}#{provided_timestamp}"```

Or simply:
```    method_url_body = "#{request.request_method}#{request.original_url}#{raw_payload}#{provided_timestamp}"```
Ok thank you!
very good :slightly_smiling_face: well done <@U06SDFMD947> !

Hoping someone can help here?

My first Public App integration. 

I have everything set up already, I am providing a response to the fetch request.

The response is accepted and some of the data is displaying, however for each string response, I get Invalid Property displayed in HubSpot.

I did have the same issue with currency, however realised I needed to send a currency code with the data and that works fine and displays the values.

Just strings are not doing that.

These are the properties I am responding with, is there something I am missing?

Hello. I have a technical question about using HubSpot object exports via API. I configured it to give me a CSV file with all the properties of each object, but when I get the export I get a .zip file, which is strange because before it only exported the .csv file itself.
My question is: When will a .zip be thrown when requesting an object export? Because I tried it and it gave me a .zip file with only a .csv file inside it.

The last time I used it I sent a POST to that endpoint: <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/exports/export/async> and then checked with a GET on: <https://api-na1.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/exports/export/async/tasks/$taskId/status> until it was done.

Yes, I did that, but I did something: In the POST request I had defined a few properties of the object to be exported, when I assigned many more properties it exported the CSV file inside a zip archive
Is that normal?

Hi,

Can someone please explain the difference between "private apps" and "developer apps"? My understanding is that:
â¢ *Private apps:* meant for *oauth-based server-to-server* flow, use mainly to interactions from our own servers with our own HubSpot account.
â¢ *Developer apps:* meant for *oauth based client credentials* flow, used mainly for interactions from our own servers with our customer accounts.
Is that correct?
I got a CSV out, not sure why you get a ZIP.
but if you, you probably could unpack it - my script was all in php

<@U073724UWFN> I think this is right, meantime I never heard about `Developer apps`
so far, I know there is `private` and `public` apps.
Please visit <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/guides/apps/overview|HS Docs>.
Maybe the quantity of parameters? Because with a Lot of properties that returned the zip.
Do you want my PHP file?
I don't know so much about PHP, but, could yo show me how you call the endpoint please?
